column4: re: USB stick. I'd copy all the files on the live cd to the USB stick then install SYSLINUX
I need it under 128M, btw.  How would I go about "install SYSLINUX"?
SYSLINUX is a bootloader just like lilo and grub, but simpler
and I don't thinnk u can readily strip the Ubuntu live CD down
Ah.  Wiki reference for doing it perhaps?
go to the SYSLINUX homepage. ask google
There's a wiki page about customizing it, so it can be done, but it sounded complicated.
Okay.
customizing the live cd would be pretty involved
That's what it sounded like.
It would be nice if I could pick and choose more easily somehow.
u might as well copy a live Ubuntu HDD install onto the USB stick and use UnionFS (YMMV)
if u want a modular live CD, try slax
Whoa, okay, that went over my head.  live HDD install?  Isn't that redundant?  Don't recognize UnionFS or "YMMV" either.
well, try slax if u want modular or Damn Small Linux if u want small
Bah, not redundant.  Contradictory I meant.
DSL didn't work though, which is why I was hoping for Ubuntu's hardware detection.
the live CD is an read-only image of a live HDD install
Ah.
so in order to create a custom one, u have to have a live HDD install working  :)
Okay.
